main event: A bright light source behind a cloud mass was observed in Newby on August 29, 1957.
interesting points: The object was slightly elliptical in shape and moved quickly through the sky., Initial interpretations suggested it could be a meteor but was later discounted., The sighting duration was several seconds., The motion of the object did not align with known astronomical or aeronautical phenomena., The reliability of the witness is considered good despite the uncertainty of the object.
sighted object: bright light source behind a cloud mass
witness description: the witness reported seeing the object move rapidly and silently
